> Axel took down the rtcontrib tutorial as a protest of EFA lighting design
> guidelines for daylight simulation.


> http://www.jaloxa.eu/resources/radiance/documentation/docs/rtcontrib_lesson.pdf


> Robin Mitchell


Indeed, there has been quite a bit of debate about the EFA guidelines in particular, and climate-based daylight modelling in general.  Axel's views on these developments are detailed in an article he wrote for the Lighting Journal last September (see pages 15-17):


http://issuu.com/matrixprint/docs/lightingjournal_september


I've attempted to respond to these and similar concerns in a paper recently presented at the CIBSE Technical Symposium (16th April 2015).  Titled "Climate-based daylight modelling and its discontents" it should be freely available for download from the CIBSE website:


http://www.cibse.org/Knowledge/CIBSE-Technical-Symposium-2015/Climate-based-daylight-modelling-and-its-disconten


Drop me a line if you have difficulty getting hold of it.


Cheers
John
